colorNumber38 = 0
colorNumber48 = 1

Procs

proc cxRGBCol(acol: CXRGB): string {...}{.raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}

cxRGBcol

returns a color build from rgb values passed in via CXRGB type tuple

Note the colCol string value of the cxRGB type is not used here 

proc cxRndRGB(): string {...}{.raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}

cxRndRGB

returns a random color string useable by var. print procs

suitable only for terminals supporting truecolor like konsole

other terminals will display some bland color most of the time

use rndCol() or randCol() instead.

                                  tags: [RootEffect, ReadEnvEffect].}
proc getCxTrueColorSet(min: int = 0; max: int = 888; step: int = 12; flag48: bool = false): bool {...}{.
    discardable, raises: [IOError, ValueError, Exception],
    tags: [RootEffect, ReadEnvEffect, WriteIOEffect].}

getcxTrueColorSet

this function fills the global cxTrueCol seq with truecolor values and needs to be run once if truecolor functiona ## now all cxtruecolor stuff needs a call to

getCxTrueColorSet() and compilation with -d:cxTrueCol then it will work like expectedlity exceeding stdlib support required see cx.nim if it is currently enabled for this version of the library

rndTrueCol

returns a random color from the cxtruecolorset for use as foreground color in var. print functions

rndTrueCol2

rndTrueCol

checkCxTrueColor
